New Records: Germany will host the UEFA EURO 2024, marking the first time since reunification and 36 years after West Germany hosted in 1988.
Key Match Events: The opening match of the tournament will be Germany vs. Scotland on June 14, 2024, at the Munich Football Arena.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany, as the home nation, is highly anticipated to leverage their home advantage to secure a fourth EURO title, building on their previous victories in 1972, 1980, and 1996.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The tournament will feature matches in ten venues across Germany, including nine used during the 2006 FIFA World Cup. The Munich Football Arena will host matches in consecutive EURO tournaments, having also been a venue for UEFA EURO 2020.
Others: Germany is seeded in Group A and will play against Scotland, Hungary, and Switzerland in the group stage.
